intro: Here's a short overview of who I am.
intro_1: Hi, I'm Elisabeth, 22 years old, and currently studying Media Informatics in my fifth semester.
intro_2: I'm passionate about combining technology and creativity — not just making things work, but designing them in a meaningful and thoughtful way. When I work on a project, I give it my full commitment. I quickly familiarize myself with new topics, take on responsibility, and see larger challenges as motivation rather than something intimidating.
intro_3: It's important to me to continuously grow both professionally and personally. I enjoy working in a team, supporting others whenever I can, and I value honest feedback.
intro_4: Outside of my studies, I'm involved in many creative activities — from model building and drawing to gaming. For me, experimenting and learning new things is simply part of who I am.
intro_5: I'm looking for a company where I can contribute long-term, take on responsibility, and grow together as part of a team.

milefiz_descr_1: The objective of this project was to reimagine and technically implement the classic board game Malefiz as an online-capable first-person multiplayer game. The focus was on a network-based multiplayer architecture that enables multiple players to play together in real-time in an interactive 3D environment.
milefiz_descr_2: Development took place across five sprints following Scrum methodology. As stakeholder, Prof. Dr. Weitz defined key requirements, including five game pieces per player, import and export functions, an integrated map editor, strategic repositioning of barriers, and mini-games between players.
milefiz_descr_3: The project was implemented by a team of ten members.
milefiz_tasks_4: Design and layout of the standard game board
milefiz_tasks_5: Implementation of the website landing page
milefiz_tasks_6: Backend implementation of the energy system
milefiz_learning_5: Sprint planning and execution as Scrum Master
lernwolke_descr_1: The objective of this project was to identify a concrete problem based on a guiding 'How-might-we' question and develop a solution concept. The implementation was to be realized as a non-WIMP application, deliberately going beyond classical graphical user interfaces with windows, icons, menus, and mouse interaction.
lernwolke_descr_2: The evaluation focused on conceptual development, so a functional prototype was sufficient as an implementation form. Initially, several different solution approaches were developed, analyzed, and compared. Based on this, a final solution was selected and subsequently developed and implemented as a prototype.
lernwolke_tasks_5: Documentation of the project in the form of a booklet
lernwolke_learning_1: Development of a concept based on theoretical foundations
lernwolke_learning_4: Implementation of an AR application in Unity
lernwolke_resources_subtitle: Find additional materials like spritesheets, the Unity project, and assets here:
lernwolke_resources_link: Hessenbox – All project files and resources
hollowKnight_descr_1: The objective of this module was to develop a secure and structured approach to Adobe After Effects. The focus was on the conception and production of a 1:30–2:00 minute video that combines animated elements, typographic design, and targeted cuts and transitions.
hollowKnight_descr_2: The topic, visual direction, and content implementation were freely selectable, so in addition to technical skills, conceptual and design decisions were developed independently.
hollowKnight_tasks_4: Creation of assets in Procreate and Adobe Illustrator
hollowKnight_tasks_5: Animation of individual scenes in Adobe After Effects
hollowKnight_learning_3: Puppet Pin Tool animation in Adobe After Effects
doener_descr_1: The objective of this project was to develop a complete döner rental system that integrates backend and frontend components. The goal was to create a web-based system where users can view, rent, and return döners, while administrators manage users and döners.
doener_descr_2: The implementation took place over several weeks in the 4th semester, with the frontend realized using Vue.js and Thymeleaf. The backend is based on Spring Boot and communicates with the frontend via REST APIs. Gradle was used for build and project management.
doener_descr_3: The project was carried out as a group work, with iterative development and integration of the various system components in focus. The project was implemented in collaboration with Leon Schäfer.
doener_repo_descr: The complete project can be found here:
doener_repo_link: GitHub Repository - View the program code and implementation
doener_tasks_1: Building a backend system with Spring Boot for managing döner rental logic including API endpoints
doener_tasks_2: Implementation of a REST API for communication between frontend and backend
doener_tasks_3: Creation of a frontend client with Vue.js providing the user interface for the system
doener_tasks_4: Integration of a login function (with simple fixed credentials for demonstration)
doener_tasks_5: Definition and modeling of central data structures (e.g. döners, ingredients, inventory) in the backend
doener_tasks_6: Building the rental logic to allow users to rent and return döners in the system
doener_tasks_7: Use of Gradle as a build tool for project configuration and server startup
doener_tasks_8: Linking frontend and backend functionalities via defined API routes and data retrieval
doener_learning_1: Experience in full-stack development with Vue.js, Thymeleaf, and Spring Boot
doener_learning_2: Implementation and use of REST APIs for frontend-backend communication
doener_learning_3: Data modeling for döners, ingredients, inventory, and rental logic
doener_learning_4: Use of Gradle for build, project management, and server startup
doener_learning_5: Implementation of login and user management functionality
melody_descr_1: The objective of this project was to develop an interactive JavaFX application as a team. The application was to be structured according to the MVC principle and implement a self-designed game idea.
melody_descr_2: In addition to programming, the project deepened knowledge of structuring JavaFX applications, including the integration of music and sound effects that were thematically and functionally integrated into the game.
melody_descr_3: The project was implemented as group work with Leon Schäfer and Marlon Stamm, with emphasis on collaboration, task coordination, and the exchange of ideas during development.
melody_tasks_1: Development of the user interface and scene logic with JavaFX (UI layouts, animations, controls)
melody_tasks_2: Implementation of the MVC pattern, including separation of Model, View, and Controller
melody_tasks_3: Integration and control of music and sound effects in the game context
melody_tasks_4: Implementation of game mechanics and interactivity (event handling, player controls)
melody_tasks_5: Collaboration in the team for planning, coordination, and development of the overall application
melody_learning_1: Deepened JavaFX skills, particularly in building interactive user interfaces and scene control
melody_learning_2: Strengthened practical application of MVC architecture and understanding of the clean separation of Model, View, and Controller
melody_learning_3: Implemented integration of music and sound effects and learned how to functionally and thematically embed audiovisual elements
melody_learning_4: Developed game mechanics and event logic, gaining experience in controlling interactions and workflows
melody_learning_5: Practiced teamwork and improved the ability to coordinate, distribute tasks, and collaborate in a group project
melody_learning_6: First experience working collaboratively in a Git repository
mp3_descr_1: The objective of this project was to implement an MP3 player as an introduction to JavaFX development. The focus was on implementing fundamental music player functions such as play, pause, shuffle, repeat, volume control, progress display, and playlist view.
mp3_descr_2: The application was to be structured according to the MVC principle to ensure a clear separation between user interface, logic, and data storage. Additionally, visual elements such as album artwork and progress bars were to be integrated into the interface.
mp3_descr_3: The project was created in collaboration with Leon Schäfer.
mp3_tasks_1: Development of the user interface and scene logic with JavaFX (UI layouts, animations, controls)
mp3_tasks_2: Implementation of the MVC pattern, including separation of Model, View, and Controller
mp3_tasks_3: Integration and control of music and sound effects
mp3_tasks_4: Implementation of MP3 logic (pause, seek, playlist display)
mp3_tasks_5: Development of an attractive user interface
mp3_learning_2: First practical application of MVC architecture
mp3_learning_3: Integration of music and sound effects in an interactive system
mp3_learning_4: First experience working collaboratively in a Git repository
yd_descr_1: The objective of this project was to design a complete website for a freely invented yet realistically conceived startup. For this, a coherent business concept including name, logo, and visual identity was to be developed first.
yd_descr_2: In the further course, wireframes were to be created to structure the website, a consistent style guide was to be defined, and based on this, an interactive clickable prototype was to be implemented. Wireframes and prototype were to be realized in Figma. The principle of Atomic Design was to be applied so that reusable, modular UI components were developed that could be consistently used multiple times and adjusted centrally.
yd_descr_3: This project was a group work with Paula Petrovic and Jacob Scharf and was intended to promote both conceptual and design skills in the field of UI/UX design.
yd_tasks_1: Developing an independent startup concept including name, business idea, and brand identity
yd_tasks_2: Designing a visual identity with logo, color palette, and typography
yd_tasks_3: Create structured wireframes in Figma to define page layout and user navigation
yd_tasks_4: Develop a consistent style guide to establish design guidelines and UI rules
yd_tasks_5: Implement an interactive clickable prototype in Figma to realistically simulate user interaction
yd_tasks_6: Documentation of the project in the form of a custom-designed booklet
yd_learning_1: A comprehensive understanding of developing a brand identity was built
yd_learning_2: Knowledge of creating wireframes and user-oriented site structure was deepened
yd_learning_3: Confidence in working with style guides and design systems was gained
yd_learning_4: Experience in creating interactive prototypes in Figma was gathered
yd_learning_5: The ability to work as a team in the design process was further developed
bkl_modul: Introduction to Design (Fundamentals of Media Design)
bkl_descr_1: The objective of this project was the design development of a booklet in which various design tasks are brought together. Over several weeks, worksheets on different design topics were worked on, which dealt with fundamental design principles.
bkl_descr_2: The individual tasks were not only to be understood theoretically but also applied practically and worked out design-wise. The conscious application of design fundamentals such as layout, typography, color theory, and composition was at the forefront.
bkl_descr_3: Finally, all processed content was to be brought together in a consistently designed booklet and prepared for printing, resulting in a physical end product.
bkl_tasks_1: Design-wise processing of weekly worksheets on various design topics
bkl_tasks_2: Practical application of design fundamentals such as typography, layout, color theory, and composition
bkl_tasks_3: Structured wireframes in Figma were created to define page layout and user navigation
bkl_tasks_4: A consistent style guide was developed to establish design guidelines and UI rules
bkl_tasks_5: An interactive clickable prototype in Figma was implemented to realistically simulate user interaction
bkl_tasks_6: Documentation of the project in the form of a custom-designed booklet
bkl_learning_1: Understanding of fundamental design principles was built
bkl_learning_2: Confidence in handling typography, layout, and color design was developed
bkl_learning_3: A sense for visual consistency and design systematicity was strengthened
bkl_learning_4: Knowledge in print preparation was expanded
bkl_learning_5: The ability to bring individual tasks together into a coherent overall project was fostered
